intro: Rubus sempervirens, commonly known as evergreen blackberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
